elements.title: Matahi Brightwell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Matahi Brightwell (pictured) reintroduced the sport of waka ama to New Zealand?

elements.title: First Bishops' War (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the First Bishops' War, the Duke of Hamilton's mother intended to shoot him with silver bullets if he landed in Scotland?

elements.title: Warren Lawrence (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Warren Lawrence, the first Dominican swimmer at the Commonwealth Games, is the son of the first Dominican swimmer at the Olympics?

elements.title: a Pennsylvania TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a high school evicted a Pennsylvania TV station?

elements.title: no kid zone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the National Library of Korea is a no kid zone?

elements.title: its first appearance at the Olympics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in its first appearance at the Olympics, Suriname was represented by a single athlete, who missed his event?

elements.title: Myinsaing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Myinsaing withstood a ten-week siege by the Mongols because its three brother leaders bribed the invaders to withdraw?

elements.title: Marcedes Walker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that basketball player Marcedes Walker became an Olympian 16 years after her WNBA career ended?

elements.title: the old man (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "the old man was startled and a little shocked" when he was shown Walter Frere's revision of his book?
